segments.text: The tea smells good . What tea is it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's a special green tea named Longing Tea from Zhejiang province .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What's special about it except its pleasant smell ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You can see that it keeps the original color of the tea leaves very well .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They must have some special methods to do this during the process .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Probably . I love green tea . It's one of my daily necessities .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then , do you have “ tea time ” every day ? I mean , do you drink tea at a settled time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not really . But I really love to have after-meal tea .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There are a lot of them . In hot or warm days , tea helps to dispel the heat and brings on an instant cool with a feeling of relaxation . Moreover , the tea leaves contain a number of chemicals which are good for people's health .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Does that mean the stronger the better ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . Constant drinking of over-strong tea would do harm to people's health . So don't make your tea too strong .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Got it . What's the proper time for tea ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's fine for most time of the day . But don't have tea before bedtime .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It will give rise to occasional insomnia . OK , let's enjoy the tea before it gets cold .
segments.speaker: S2
